channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Manslaughter charges laid against three police officers in New Plymouth court
item.description: Police have filed charges of manslaughter against three officers over the death of a man in custody at the Hāwera Police Station last year.

item.title: Government hits back at opposition over level 1 urgency
item.description: Finance Minister Grant Robertson has accused the opposition of belittling New Zealanders' achievement in the fight against Covid-19.

item.title: Air NZ on non-refundable airfares: 'credits' over refund
item.description: Checkpoint - Air New Zealand says it cannot afford to offer refunds to everyone impacted by flight cancellations during the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Air India flights to bring Kiwis home - MFAT
item.description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade is aware of a proposal for a private charter flight to get people stranded in India home, but says its focus is on a plan by the Indian authorities.

item.title: Government to provide free sanitary items in schools
item.description: The government is taking steps to tackle period poverty by providing free products in schools.

item.title: Quake-damaged Wellington Library to be repaired, council decides
item.description: Wellington councillors have made refitting and strengthening the existing library their preference, rather than building a new one.

item.title: Dunedin on the fast track to end slowdown
item.description: The Dunedin City Council will decide on Monday whether to end a controversial project designed to entice people back to the central city after the Covid-19 lockdown.

item.title: Napier City Council to weigh up costly pipe decision
item.description: Napier City Council is being threatened with prosecution if it fails to fix a pipe leaking wastewater into the Pacific Ocean.

item.title: Hamilton cannabis bust linked to Tribal Huk gang - police
item.description: The police have seized property and shares worth $2.4 million in a Hamilton cannabis bust.

item.title: Rainbow youth sector says Covid-19 response lacks funding for its communities
item.description: A collective of rainbow organisations say the government's Rebuilding Together Budget lacks any specific funding for their communities at a time when they face more challenges than ever.

item.title: Police rule out legal action against protest organisers
item.description: The organisers of Black Lives Matter protests in New Zealand will not be prosecuted.

item.title: Warning signs removed after E coli forces closure of Titahi Bay beach
item.description: Broken pipes and faecal contamination are continuing to plague the Wellington region, most recently in Porirua's Titahi Bay.

item.title: Feedback sought for river landings along Christchurch red zone
item.description: The Christchurch City Council wants the public's feedback on a proposal for the first of a series of landings along the Ōtākaro Avon River within the earthquake damaged red zone.

item.title: Iwi and Nelson council housing project raises fears for Maitai river
item.description: A Nelson City Councillor is worried that a planned development will harm an important city river.

item.title: Hastings Council water museum leak: $25k report fails to find source
item.description: A $25,000 investigation into the leak of confidential information about a Hastings District Council plan has been unable to identify the source.

item.title: NCEA changes ease pressure on teenagers
item.description: The changes, announced by the government, give teachers the discretion to award students a limited number of credits, and also lower the number of credits needed for certain benchmarks.

item.title: Police name man found dead after central Auckland shooting
item.description: A man who was found dead after a shooting incident in central Auckland on Monday has been identified.

item.title: Orchard workers jailed for abduction and sexual assault
item.description: Two orchard workers, who laughed as they sexually violated a woman they had abducted, have been jailed.
